content.description:
Girls Skool climbs a stretch of crunchy, low-density rock between CHUD and Desert Sportsman. If the rock was better, this route would be quite good, but as it is very few holds are solid. The grade may feel sandbagged (perhaps holds have broken since the FA). 

  Begin on the huge, hollow flakes of CHUD then step right with difficulty to the line.
content.protection: 8 bolts to steel drop-ins. Consider stick clipping the second or third bolt as a fall from the traverse past the first bolt could result in a violent fall.

content.description: This is a nice long route (by Red Rock standards), that has sustained 5.11 climbing the whole way.     Scramble up to the first bolt, and then begin heading left toward the second bolt, where you have to go a bit of a distance hard left to the third bolt.  This part is a bit intimidating, but the moves are not too bad.  From here, head straight up the face where you will encounter a wide variety of climbing situations.  This is not your typical Red Rock crimpfest.
content.location: This is the right most sport route on the upper tier of the Broast and Toast wall.

climbs.name: C. H. U. D.
climbs.fa: Paul VanBetten, Bob Conz, Richard Harrison, Sal Mamusia

content.description: Start on the left most line of bolts at a large fragile looking flake.  Boulder a couple of moves to get off the ground, then a few easy moves lead to the business.  Follow sidepull flakes and edges to a short steep section at the top.  At the last bolt look to your right for the anchors, as it is easy to get suckered into going straight up.
content.location: This is the left most route on the wall.

content.description: This crag is located northwest of the trailhead that leaves the parking lot, and can actually be seen from there.  This crag is just up the small canyon from the Sonic Youth Wall, and faces west (the opposite direction of Sonic Youth).   Most of the routes here are trad or mixed, however, there are three sport routes located on the left side of the wall.
